title.narrative: Takhiatash Power Plant Efficiency Improvement Project

description.narrative: The project, to be implemented in the Takhiatash thermal power plant (TPP), involves building two combined-cycle gas turbine (CCGT) units, decommissioning old and inefficient power generation units, improving energy efficiency, and increasing power supply to the Karakalpakstan and Khorezm regions. It includes a capacity development component to improve corporate performance and a social development component to foster gender equality.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Increased energy-efficient power supply in Karakalpakstan and Khorezm regions

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Takhiatash TPP gas consumption decreased from 1,117 million cubic meter (m3) (2011) to 799 million m3 by 2020

description.narrative: Increased energy-efficient power supply in Karakalpakstan and Khorezm regions

title.narrative: Takhiatash TPP GHG emission reduced from 2.1 mtCO2e (2011) to 1.7 mtCO2e by 2020

description.narrative: Increased energy-efficient power supply in Karakalpakstan and Khorezm regions

title.narrative: Thermal efficiency of the new plant increased from 23.7% (2011) to 52% by 2020

description.narrative: Increased energy-efficient power supply in Karakalpakstan and Khorezm regions

title.narrative: Power generated from Takhiatash TPP increased from 3,276 GWh (2011) to 3,896 GWh by 2020

description.narrative: Increased energy-efficient power supply in Karakalpakstan and Khorezm regions

title.narrative: Takhiatash TPP water consumption decreased from 453 million m3 (2011) to 51 million m3 by 2020

description.narrative: Increased energy-efficient power supply in Karakalpakstan and Khorezm regions
